learning_objectives.description: The importance of a well-motivated workforce: Why people work and what motivation means; The benefits of a well-motivated workforce: labour productivity, reduced absenteeism and labour turnover; The concept of human needs, e.g. Maslow's hierarchy; Key motivational theories: Taylor and Herzberg

Methods of motivation: Financial rewards, e.g. wage, salary, bonus, commission and profit sharing; Non-financial methods, e.g. job enrichment, job rotation, teamworking, training, opportunities for promotion; Recommend and justify appropriate method(s) of motivation in given circumstances
